thread.title: Three workers killed in landslide in Sylhet
thread.title_full: Three workers killed in landslide in Sylhet

title: Three workers killed in landslide in Sylhet
text:
Three workers killed in landslide in Sylhet Sylhet Correspondent bdnews24.com Published: 2017-02-10 14:19:42.0 BdST Updated: 2017-02-10 14:19:42.0 BdST Three workers have died in a landslide while illegally extracting stones in Sylhet. 
Police said the incident happened near Bichanakandi quarry in Goainghat Upazila around 2:30am Friday. 
The victims, all hailing from Sunamganj, are Zakir Hossain, 20, Tula Mia, 25. Another person who died was from Dirai Upazila but his name is not yet known. 
The workers were illegally lifting stones from a pit owned byone Bachhit Mia near Badepasha ferry terminal when a mound fell on them, leaving them dead on spot, said Goainghat police OC Delwar Hossain. 
The OC added that illegal stone traders removed the bodies from the spot soon after the incident. 
"Bodies of Zakir and Tula have been found. Police is trying to trace the other body." 
This the second incident of landslide killing workers, reported from Sylhet within a span of more than two weeks. 
On Jan 23, five workers died in a landslide while extracting stones from a hillock in Companyganj Upazila. 
Influential stone traders moved the three bodies to cover up the incident. The bodies were later found in Netrokona.
